BR_text.BRsummary: ray install-nightly installs older version than docs links
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
 
 Installing using ray install-nightly:
 <denchmark-code>(base) code/ray % docker run -it rayproject/ray:latest bash
 (base) root@4c73acfbdc9f:/# ray install-nightly
 ...
 (base) root@4c73acfbdc9f:/# python -c "import ray;print(ray.__version__);print(ray.__commit__)"
 1.1.0.dev0
 9527220a868fbd57aa7617fa9a5eacecd56602db
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Installing with link from docs:
 <denchmark-code>(base) code/ray % docker run -it rayproject/ray:latest bash
 (base) root@4c73acfbdc9f:/# pip install -U https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/ray-wheels/latest/ray-1.1.0.dev0-cp37-cp37m-manylinux2014_x86_64.whl
 ...
 (base) root@4c73acfbdc9f:/# python -c "import ray;print(ray.__version__);print(ray.__commit__)"
 1.1.0.dev0
 4ada3e4c9952ffd6f573f9813a0231bafc6cf17c
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
 
 Please provide a script that can be run to reproduce the issue. The script should have no external library dependencies (i.e., use fake or mock data / environments):
 If we cannot run your script, we cannot fix your issue.
 
  I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue.
  I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.

comments_1.comment_text: Yeah, basically the latest ray wheels are being written to a new path (updated after 1.0.1 was released).
